thoughts.content: Initial assessment: need to audit React+Vite project for performance bottlenecks; plan to inspect bundle size drivers, heavy components, and opportunities for lazy loading and asset optimization.

Implementation plan: add React.lazy/Suspense for below-the-fold sections, optimize HeroSection scroll handling with motion values, and default all project imagery to lazy loading while shrinking remote image payloads.
Verification attempt: Vite build currently fails (`vite` missing) because dependencies aren’t installed; will report this alongside recommended install step.
Need context: inspect project structure; find theme or dark mode logic. Possibly Next.js or static site. Determine default theme handling.
Need to locate the section that renders the dotted background behind the “Let’s Connect” heading to adjust layout so dots don’t overlap the title.
Adjust particle generation so random dots skip a safe area around the heading while keeping the animated effect elsewhere.
Need to locate Zack image usage in project, check new asset in resource folder, then update references to use new image without zoom (likely adjust CSS/layout or cropping).

Understand project structure and personalization settings for effects/motion toggle; identify where effects are controlled; adjust logic to disable when user turns off personalization toggle; verify behavior conceptually.

Animations still run when toggle off—identify components still animating despite enableMotion flag (e.g., ProjectsCarousel overlays). Update them to render static or disable initial/animate props when motion disabled.
